text.p: Following are some of the main stories in Dutch newspapers today. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
FINANCIEELE DAGBLAD
- Labour party PvdA wants to put aside major part of budgetary windfall to finance age pension benefits. (p1)
- ABN Amro weighs appeal against recent court decision introducing separate pay-and-conditions for call centre staff. (p1)
- Transport group Nedlloyd's chairman Leo Berndsen says European Union should protect European shipowners. (p2)
- Publisher VNU sells 12 pct stake in printer Roto Smeets de Boer. (p3)
- Philips Electronics to slash jobs in flat screen plant in Eindhoven. (p3)
- Packaging concern Van Leer signs long-term worldwide agreement with U.S. concern Dow Chemical. (p3)
- Temp agency Randstad sets up new arm for large industrial companies. (p5)
VOLKSKRANT
- Sports-only TV channel Sport 7 receiver claims Dfl 200 million from soccer association KNVB. (p1)
- Building concern Ballast-Nedam considers takeover of large German builder Wayss & Freytag. (p2)
- Savings bank SNS buys prestigious Banque de Suez. (p2)
- Economic affairs minsiter Hans Wijers to attack "unreasonable high" tariffs of cable operators. (p3)
DE TELEGRAAF
- Dutch 1996 economic growth seen at 2.75 pct, higher than expected. (p1)
- Dutch inland revenue misses dozens of millions of guilders through international trade in Eurovignette for trucks. (p3)
- Net profit of Dutch businesses expected to rise strongly in 1997. (p41)
- Fokker receivers stand little chance of cancelling one billion guilders the aircraft maker paid just before it applied for suspension of payment. (p41)
ALGEMEEN DAGBLAD
- Engineering bureau Fugro buys parts of British Oceonics for Dfl 17.5 million. (p13)
- FNV union opposes larger influence for shareholders in company policy. (p15)
TROUW
- Industrial concern Stork's unit Fokker Aerostructures to participate in preliminary design of super Airbus. (p1)
- Pay and conditions talks between unions and small engineering businesses broken off without result. (p2)
